intro: Tithymalus leptophyllus, commonly known as the slender-leaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
